page.title: 20CREDITS WELBURY & DEIGHTON
page.content:
These two villages remained relatively unchanged for many hundreds of years as agricultural communities.The production of linen in the 1800's and the railway in 1860 brought a different way of life.However in the last 40 years major changes such as electricity,mains water,private transport,telephone etc.,have dramatically changed the old village life style.Although the land is still used for agriculture,the majority of the villagers commute to industrial and commercial centres for work.
LINDA CROSBY,JANE GREENWELL,DERVOR HANSON,CHRISTINE HENRY.JANET HUTCHINS, MRS.KIRBY SNR.,JOAN & VERITY MURDOCH, LEONIE O'CARROLL,JOHN OVENSTON, ELIZABETH SIMPSON,PHYLL WADE.
